CatDescriptText: Rudolph Hawthorne, employee at Penn Camera, 1800 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (padding) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: "The kids need it, and I think that the teachers should hand it out because it will make the kids think twice before they do anything wrong, or perhaps make a mistake in later life."
TitMainTitle: Rudolph Hawthorne wearing light colored button down collared shirt with rolled sleeves, dark sleeveless sweater vest, moustache, and dark cap, standing in front of wall with hanging documents and sign for Sylvania Flashbulbs, in interior, possibly Penn Camera, with staircase
